output.conclusion: This course provided a foundational understanding of kinematics. Further exploration of dynamics and more complex motion scenarios will build upon these principles.
output.introduction: Welcome to the world of motion! This course will introduce you to the basic concepts of kinematics, the study of motion without considering the forces that cause it. We'll explore displacement, velocity, and acceleration in a clear and accessible way.

chapters.description: Learn the difference between displacement (change in position) and distance (total path length). Explore examples of calculating displacement in one dimension.
A brief introduction to vectors, emphasizing their use in representing displacement.  Covers vector notation and basic vector addition in one dimension.
Define average velocity (displacement over time) and average speed (distance over time). Work through example problems.
Introduce the concept of instantaneous velocity as the velocity at a specific point in time. Discuss its relation to average velocity.

modules.moduleTitle: Velocity: How Fast and in What Direction?

chapters.description: Define acceleration as the rate of change of velocity. Discuss positive and negative acceleration and their implications.
Explore motion with constant acceleration. Introduce the basic kinematic equation:  v = v0 + at.
